Articles.Content:
Hello Internet!

I am currently planning my first manned interplanetary mission to Duna.

My spaceship looks good so far, but I'm having trouble planning the amount of fuel I need

![front_dunagirder_1g8kz4.png](http://abload.de/img/front_dunagirder_1g8kz4.png)

(the fuselages on the left are placeholders for a Mk1-Rover)

There are 4 tanks and 5 engines. How can I tell KER to calculate the ÃŽâ€v of the main ship using only the orange tank and the two LV-Ns?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T12:48:31Z" title="06/24/2015 12:48  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by Dildred**

Welcome aboard!

Disable all the other tanks in the right click menu, or disable fuel crossfeed for the docking ports in the right click menu, then KER should calculate what you want.

You might also consider a different fuel tank for your LV-Ns, the oxidizer in the orange tank is not used by nuclear engines and even if tweaked out the dry mass of the tank is quite high. Perhaps a liquid-fuel-only tank like one of the Mk3 tanks would be better.

Wow, that was quick! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thank you very much, Sir Red Iron Crown, my problem is solved!

Indeed, the Mk3-tank would be a much better choice, half the size, double the fuel. Thanks for the hint!
